step1.sentence: After deleting social media apps from her phone, she finally felt like she could reclaim her time and focus on what truly mattered.

step2.story: Marcus had been saying yes to every meeting and favor for months, and his calendar was completely out of his control. One Sunday, he sat down and blocked off mornings for deep work, determined to reclaim his time. By the end of the week, he had finished a project he had been putting off for two months.

step3.story: For years, Priya had let her evenings slip away—scrolling through her phone, answering late work emails, and feeling vaguely exhausted without knowing why. Then a friend challenged her to track exactly how she spent each hour for one week. The results were eye-opening: nearly three hours a day went to habits she hadn't consciously chosen. She decided it was time to reclaim her time and be intentional about every part of her day. She started with small changes—a no-phone rule after 9 PM and a dedicated hour each morning for reading. Within a month, she felt calmer, more focused, and genuinely in control of her life again.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 자신의 시간을 다시 가져오다, 즉 빼앗기거나 낭비된 시간을 되찾는다는 의미.
meaning.realUsageKo: 불필요한 일, 나쁜 습관, 또는 과도한 업무로 인해 잃어버린 시간을 의도적으로 회수하고 스스로 통제권을 갖는다는 맥락에서 쓰인다. 생산성, 자기 관리, 워라밸 관련 상황에서 자주 등장한다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'reclaim'은 라틴어 'reclamare(되돌려 요구하다)'에서 유래했으며, 원래 잃어버린 땅이나 재산을 되찾는다는 뜻이었다. 이 의미가 확장되어 시간, 자유, 정체성 등 추상적인 것을 되찾는다는 의미로도 쓰이게 되었다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 단순히 여유 시간을 만드는 것이 아니라, 주체적으로 자신의 삶을 통제한다는 능동적이고 결연한 뉘앙스가 강하다. 자기계발이나 경계 설정 맥락에서 긍정적이고 힘 있는 표현으로 사용된다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: He turned off notifications and started reclaiming his time one hour at a time.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 그는 알림을 끄고 한 번에 한 시간씩 자신의 시간을 되찾기 시작했다.
